文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_019_chunk3
证据片段: In a typical operating PWR, the primary coolant normally contains a basic additive [for example, lithium hydroxide (LiOH) or ammonium hydroxide $( \mathbf { N H } _ { 4 } \mathbf { O H } )$ at nominal (room temperature) $\mathfrak { p H }$ of 10] to minimize corrosion and corrosion transport of plant materials, additions of hydrogen (or ammonia, or both) to reduce the oxygen concentration in the coolant, oxygen levels maintained below 0.05 ppm oxygen by virtue of the hydrogen additions, and possibly a chemical shim, usually boric acid, in the range 0 to 2500 ppm boron.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_019_chunk3
证据片段: Under these highly reducing conditions, it is the general consensus that either Zircaloy does not experience an irradiation-induced acceleration in the corrosion processes $[ I O , I 7 -$ 21] or, if excess corrosion is present, its magnitude is too small for typical PWR lifetimes to be detected within the uncertainties associated with the ability to predict anticipated corrosion behavior.

证据片段: exposures to high fast neutron flux levels are involved, acceleration factors of 2.0 to 2.5 (that is, observed weight gain divided by predicted weight gain from time-temperature history) have been encountered, even in the "highly reducing" environments [22].

证据片段: Even with the 2.5-fold increase, the total corrosion product formation $( \neg 1 1 \ \mu \mathbf { m }$ , maximum) did not detract from the normal operation of the reactor.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_019_chunk3
证据片段: It has been shown repeatedly that in PWR systems where there has been either deliberate or inadvertent additions of oxygen to the coolant, the presence of fast neutron flux (or fluence) produces a pronounced enhancement of the Zircaloy corrosion rate [21,23-26].

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_019_chunk3
证据片段: It also has been observed that when the oxygen content in the coolant is high, a very dramatic reduction in hydrogen pickup is produced, whereas smaller oxygen contents can result in only minor decreases in hydrogen absorption [15].

证据片段: Boiling Water Reactors (BWR)-Boiling water reactors normally are operated in pure (neutral) water with the radiolytic decomposition gases hydrogen and oxygen being stripped continually from the water into the steam phase.

证据片段: Due to the oxygenated environment, the corrosion of Zircaloy-2 and -4 in BWRs is enhanced over that experienced in ex-reactor experiments [15,29-39].
